Description: Small pottery storage jar or flask with banded decoration in White Painted ware; wheelmade; elongated body on a low base; tall narrow neck tapering inwards to an everted rim; ridge around the junciton of shoulder and neck; pair of tall arching handles from shoulder to below the rim; made of buff clay decorated with parallel bands of matt brown-black paint around the body.
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Luigi Palma di Cesnola
